memberdef.type: eosio::multi_index<"nfts"_n, nft_struct, indexed_by< "account"_n, const_mem_fun< nft_struct, uint64_t, &nft_struct::get_secondary > >, indexed_by< "active"_n, const_mem_fun< nft_struct, uint64_t, &nft_struct::get_active_nft > > >
memberdef.definition: using freedao::nft_table = typedef eosio::multi_index<"nfts"_n, nft_struct, indexed_by< "account"_n, const_mem_fun<nft_struct, uint64_t, &nft_struct::get_secondary> >, indexed_by< "active"_n, const_mem_fun<nft_struct, uint64_t, &nft_struct::get_active_nft> > >
memberdef.name: nft_table

memberdef.type: eosio::multi_index<"nfts"_n, copynft_struct, indexed_by<"account"_n, const_mem_fun< copynft_struct, uint64_t, &copynft_struct::get_secondary > > >
memberdef.definition: using freedao::copynft_table = typedef eosio::multi_index<"nfts"_n, copynft_struct, indexed_by<"account"_n, const_mem_fun<copynft_struct, uint64_t, &copynft_struct::get_secondary> >>
memberdef.name: copynft_table

detaileddescription.para: Action checks if the account that is calling the burn action is in the burners table, and if it is, it calls the retire function

parameterdescription.para: The account that is burning the tokens.
The amount of tokens to burn.
The memo is a string that is passed along with the transfer.

briefdescription.para: POINT account used to receive dividends and for identification (as a secondary key)
Only this is used for counting dividend to pay - the other parameters examine eligibility,.
NFT mint date. In fact, the current date of the moment when this nftx record was created,.
lock dividends for selected new members. Note: When unlock should be not lock again.
max total divident (2) for horizontal cap or max weekly dividend for vertical (3) cap
count down payments left in iteration cap=1 only

detaileddescription.para: version action.
Prints the version of this contract.
Action prints out the version of the contract, the accounts that are used for the freeos tokens, freebi tokens, and the freeos divide account, and the current iteration

memberdef.argsstring: (time_point iterations_start, double issuance_rate, double mint_fee_percent_freeos, double mint_fee_percent_xpr, double mint_fee_percent_xusdc, double locking_threshold, bool pool)
memberdef.name: init

detaileddescription.para: Action initializes the system by creating the system record, the reward record for iteration 0, and the survey, vote and ratify records if they don't already exist

parameterdescription.para: the time at which the first iteration will start
the amount of points to be issued per iteration
the percentage of the issuance that goes to the freeos.io team
the percentage of the issuance that goes to the XPR pool
The percentage of the issuance that goes to the XUSDC pool.
the minimum percentage of a user's total points that must be locked in order to participate in the vote
true if the rewards are to be distributed to the pool, false if they are to be burned

detaileddescription.para: The tick() function is called every time a user runs an action. It checks that the system is operational (i.e. that the masterswitch parameter is set to 1). If the iteration has changed, the trigger_new_iteration() function is called to perform app housekeeping operations

Function performs various housekeeping activities at the switchover to a new iteration. It updates the system record with the new iteration, updates the locking threshold, calculates the issuance for the iteration, updates the rewards record, updates the exchange rate record, deletes old rewards records, and resets the survey, vote and ratify records

parameterdescription.para: the iteration number of the new iteration

detaileddescription.para: Function returns the double proportion of the total supply that should be locked, based on the current and target exchange rates in the exchangerate table. For example, a target rate of $2 and a current rate of $1.5 returns a lock proportion = 0.25. The proportion is capped at 0.9

simplesect.para: The proportion of the amount of tokens that will be locked.

detaileddescription.para: If the exchange rate is favourable, i.e current rate > target rate (good times), increase the unlock percentage. If the exchange rate is unfavourable (bad times), decrease the unlock percentage.
The rate of unlock percentage increases in good times according to a Fibonacci sequence, i.e. 1%, 2%, 3%, 5%, etc The unlock percentage is capped at 21%.
Going into 'bad times' resets the unlock percentage to 0.
"failsafe" unlocking applies in bad times. Every so many weeks, users can unlock 15%. The interval is determined by parameter: failsafefreq

Function checks if the master switch (parameter: masterswitch) is on (set to "1") or off. The masterswitch parameter is checked by all user-initiated actions. In effect this can be used to prohibit user activity in the event of a serious problem.

simplesect.para: A boolean value.

memberdef.argsstring: (string username, string account_type, uint32_t registered, uint32_t surveys, uint32_t votes, uint32_t ratifys, uint32_t issues, uint32_t last_claim, asset total)
memberdef.name: createuser

detaileddescription.para: The reguser action is called by a user to register with the Freeos system.

The function:
creates an appropriately populated record in the participants table,
creates and populates the mff (mint-fee-free) record with the user's POINTs balance,
updates the CLS with a contribution for the user

parameterdescription.para: the user's account name

detaileddescription.para: The reregister function is called by a user to update their account_type in their participant record

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user who is reregistering

detaileddescription.para: If the user is a verified user, or if the user has an NFT, then the user is verified

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user

simplesect.para: A boolean value.

detaileddescription.para: Function checks the nft_table in the dividend contract to see if the user has an active (unlocked) NFT

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user

simplesect.para: A boolean value indicating whether the user has an active NFT

detaileddescription.para: Action takes a parameter name and a value, and either inserts the parameter into the parameters table if it doesn't exist, or updates the parameter if it does exist

parameterdescription.para: The name of the parameter.
The string value of the parameter.

detaileddescription.para: Action deletes a parameter from the parameters table

parameterdescription.para: The name of the parameter to be deleted.

detaileddescription.para: Action either inserts a new double parameter into the table or updates an existing double parameter in the table

parameterdescription.para: the name of the parameter in the dparameters table
double value of the parameter

detaileddescription.para: Action deletes a double parameter from the dparameters table

parameterdescription.para: The name of the parameter to be deleted.

detaileddescription.para: Action adds an account to the transferers table: list of accounts that can transfer (allocate) POINT tokens

parameterdescription.para: The account that will be able to transfer POINT tokens.

detaileddescription.para: Action removes an account from the transferers table

parameterdescription.para: the account to be removed from the table

detaileddescription.para: Action adds a new account to the minters table: list of accounts that can issue POINT tokens.

parameterdescription.para: The account that will be able to mint (issue) tokens.

detaileddescription.para: Action removes an account from the minters table

parameterdescription.para: the account to be removed from the minters table

detaileddescription.para: Action adds an account to the burners table: people who can burn (retire) POINT tokens

parameterdescription.para: The account that will be added to the burners table.

detaileddescription.para: Action deletes an account from the burners table

parameterdescription.para: the account to be removed from the burners table

detaileddescription.para: Action sets the current FREEOS usd price in the exchangerate table

simplesect.para: Must be run under the authority of the contract or the account defined by the 'exchangeacc' parameter

parameterdescription.para: price The current price of the token which must have a positive value

detaileddescription.para: Action sets the target FREEOS usd price in the exchangerate table

simplesect.para: Must be run under the authority of the contract

parameterdescription.para: price The target price of the token which must have a positive value

detaileddescription.para: Action takes a symbol and a contract name as arguments, and then either creates a new currency entry in the currencies table or updates an existing one

parameterdescription.para: The symbol of the currency you want to add.
The contract that manages the token ledger.

detaileddescription.para: Action erases a token currency from the currencies table

parameterdescription.para: The symbol of the currency to be erased.

detaileddescription.para: Action sets the USD rate for a given token currency

simplesect.para: Must be run under the authority of the contract or the account defined by the 'exchangeacc' parameter

parameterdescription.para: the symbol of the currency to set the rate for
The USD rate of the currency.

detaileddescription.para: It returns the string value of a parameter from the parameters table

parameterdescription.para: The name of the parameter record to retrieve from the parameters table.

simplesect.para: The string value of the parameter.

detaileddescription.para: It gets the double value of a parameter from the dparameters (double parameters) table

parameterdescription.para: The name of the parameter record to get from the dparameters table.

simplesect.para: The double value of the parameter.

detaileddescription.para: It gets the integer value of a parameter from the parameters table

parameterdescription.para: The name of the parameter record to get from the parameters table.

simplesect.para: The integer value of the parameter.

memberdef.argsstring: (name user, uint8_t q1response, uint8_t q2response, uint8_t q3response, uint8_t q4response, uint8_t q5choice1, uint8_t q5choice2, uint8_t q5choice3)
memberdef.name: survey

detaileddescription.para: Action called by a user to submit their responses to the weekly survey

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user
a number between 1 and 10
the user's first choice for question 5
the user's second choice for question 5
the user's 3rd choice for question 5

detaileddescription.para: Function to create and initialise the survey results record. If the surveyrecord table is empty, then create the (single record) in the surveyrecord table
Function to reset the survey record at the beginning of a new iteration

memberdef.argsstring: (name user, uint8_t q1response, uint8_t q2response, uint8_t q2response_xpr, uint8_t q2response_xusdc, double q3response, string q4response, uint8_t q5response, uint8_t q6choice1, uint8_t q6choice2, uint8_t q6choice3, double q7response, double q8response, double q9response, uint8_t q10response)
memberdef.name: vote

detaileddescription.para: Function to create and initialise the vote results record. If the voterecord table is empty, then create the (single record) in the voterecord table
Function to reset the vote record at the beginning of a new iteration
Action called by the user each iteration to ratify the results of the vote.
The iteration number of the ratification is recorded in the user's survey-vote-ratify (SVR) record.

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user
true or false

detaileddescription.para: Function to create and initialise the ratify results record. If the ratifyrecord table is empty, then create the (single record) in the ratifyrecord table

This function is called at the start of a new iteration. It resets the ratify record in the ratifyrecord table to the current iteration, resets the number of participants to zero, and initialises the default setting of 'ratify' to false.
Action checks that the user has completed the required number of surveys, votes and ratifications, and if so, it mints the appropriate number of POINTs and transfers them to the user's account

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user who is claiming

detaileddescription.para: Action creates a new token

parameterdescription.para: The account that will issue the token.
The maximum amount of tokens that can be created.

detaileddescription.para: Function checks that the issuer is the account that's calling the function, that the quantity is valid, that the quantity is positive, that the quantity is less than the maximum supply, and then it adds the quantity to the supply and adds the quantity to the issuer's balance.
This function is called by the 'mint' action which applies a whitelist of accounts that are permitted to issue POINTs.

parameterdescription.para: The account to which the tokens are issued.
The amount of tokens to issue.
A string that can be used to store additional information about the transaction.

detaileddescription.para: Function takes an asset and a memo, checks that the asset is valid, and then subtracts the asset from the supply and the issuer's balance

This is a standard token management function that is not exposed as an action. It is called by the 'burn' action which applies a whitelist of accounts that are permitted to reduce the supply of a token.

parameterdescription.para: The amount of POINTs to retire.
A string that can be used to store additional information about the transaction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &from, const name &to, const asset &quantity, const string &memo)
memberdef.name: allocate

detaileddescription.para: Action checks if the from account is in the transferers table, and if it is, it calls the transfer function. It is therefore a wrapper for the transfer function that applies a whitelist of which accounts are permitted to transfer POINTs.

parameterdescription.para: The account that is sending the tokens.
The account that will receive the tokens.
The amount of tokens to be allocated.
The memo is a string that can be used to store additional information about the transfer.

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &minter, const name &to, const asset &quantity, const string &memo)
memberdef.name: mint

detaileddescription.para: Action checks if the minter account is in the minters table, and if it is, it calls the issue function

parameterdescription.para: the account that is allowed to mint tokens
The account to receive the tokens.
The amount of tokens to be minted.
a string that can be used to store additional information about the transaction.

memberdef.argsstring: (const name &from, const name &to, const asset &quantity, const string &memo)
memberdef.name: transfer

detaileddescription.para: Function to transfer POINT tokens from sender to receiver. This is a wrapper to the transfer function that applies a whitelist of which accounts are permitted to transfer POINTs.

parameterdescription.para: The account that is sending the tokens.
The account to which the tokens are transferred.
The amount of tokens to transfer.
A string that can be used to store additional information about the transfer.

detaileddescription.para: It subtracts the amount of the asset from the balance of the account

parameterdescription.para: The account that will be debited
The amount of tokens to be transferred.

detaileddescription.para: It adds the value of the asset to the balance of the owner

parameterdescription.para: The account to which the tokens are being transferred.
The amount of tokens to be transferred.
The account that will pay for the RAM used by the new account.

detaileddescription.para: Action takes a quantity of POINT tokens from the user and issues an equivalent amount of FREEBI tokens to the user

parameterdescription.para: the account that is minting the FREEBI tokens
the amount of POINTs to be converted to FREEBIs

memberdef.argsstring: (name user, const asset &input_quantity, symbol &mint_fee_currency, bool use_airclaim_points)
memberdef.name: mintfreeos

detaileddescription.para: Action checks that the user has paid the correct mint fee, then it issues the FREEOS tokens to the user

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user who is minting
the amount of POINTs or FREEBIs that the user is minting
the currency that the user has paid the mint fee in
If true, the user is using their Airclaim points to mint FREEOS. If false, the user is using POINTs or FREEBI to mint FREEOS.

detaileddescription.para: Action withdraws all credits from the user's credit table and transfers the credit amount back to the user's account

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user who is withdrawing their credits

detaileddescription.para: Action is called by the user to unlock some of their locked POINTs. It checks that the user has not already unlocked in the current iteration, and if not, it calculates the amount to be unlocked based on the unlock_percentage set in the system table, and then it unlocks the amount.

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user who is unlocking

simplesect.para: Nothing.

detaileddescription.para: Action deletes the deposit record for the iteration number passed in. This is called by the dividend contract after successfully processing dividends for an iteration.

parameterdescription.para: The iteration number of the deposit record to be cleared.

detaileddescription.para: Function finds the record for the iteration number, and if it doesn't exist, it creates it and initialises it with the amount, otherwise it adds the amount to the existing record.
A deposit record for an iteration records how many POINTs are to be divided by the dividend contract to NFT holders.

parameterdescription.para: The iteration number of the deposit.
The amount of the deposit

memberdef.argsstring: (name user, name to, asset quantity, std::string memo)
memberdef.name: mintfee

detaileddescription.para: When a user sends a token to the freeosgov contract, the freeosgov contract checks that the token is from the valid token contract, and then records the amount of tokens recived as a credit record in the credit table.

parameterdescription.para: the account that sent the transfer
the account that will receive the minted tokens
the amount of the fee
"freeos mint fee"

simplesect.para: The mintfee function is being returned.

detaileddescription.para: The function calculates the mint fee in the currency that the user is paying with.

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user who is minting
the amount of tokens to be exchanged for FREEOS
symbol: the currency the user is paying the mint fee with

detaileddescription.para: Function process_mint_fee checks if the user has paid the correct mint fee, and if so, erases the credit record and returns True to indicate that processing the mint fee was successful.

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user who is minting the token
the amount of tokens to be minted
the symbol of the currency that the mint fee is paid in

simplesect.para: A boolean value to indicate success or failure

detaileddescription.para: Function looks up the user's credit record for the mint fee, and if it finds one, it transfers the fee back to the user and deletes the credit record.

N.B. This function is not called. If the mintfreeos transaction fails then all actions in the transaction are rolled back, which means there is no need to refund the mint fee. The code is reserved for future use.

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user who paid the fee
the currency that the user paid the mint fee in

simplesect.para: The mint fee is being returned to the user.

detaileddescription.para: Function adjusts balances when minting FREEOS from POINTs. It takes a user and an asset, and it decreases the user's balance of the asset and burns the asset.

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user who is redeeming points
the amount of POINTs the user is trying to convert

detaileddescription.para: Function adjusts balances when minting FREEOS from POINTs. It takes a user and an asset, and it decreases the user's balance of the asset and burns the asset.

parameterdescription.para: the account name of the user who is redeeming points
the amount of POINTs the user is trying to convert

detaileddescription.para: If the current time is between the start and end of the action period, return true

parameterdescription.para: the name of the activity, i.e. "survey", "vote" or "ratify"

simplesect.para: A boolean value indicating whether the activity period is current

detaileddescription.para: The function returns the current iteration number

simplesect.para: The current iteration number.

detaileddescription.para: Function checks if the user is registered in the participants table

parameterdescription.para: The account name of the user to check.

simplesect.para: A boolean value.

detaileddescription.para: Function returns the iteration number after which the user will be deactivated

parameterdescription.para: the user account name

simplesect.para: The last iteration that the user is active.

detaileddescription.para: If the current iteration is less than or equal to the user's last active iteration, then the user is alive

parameterdescription.para: the user's account name

simplesect.para: A boolean value

detaileddescription.para: Function calculates the amount by which the Conditionally Limited Supply (CLS) will be increased on a user registration

simplesect.para: asset: The number of POINTs to add to the CLS
